Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: lots of phone screens
The process of data collection, how to interact with participants, data entry, analyzing data and how to work well with a team.
I greatly developed my research skills in taking this course, from reviewing literature, to developing stimuli, designing experiments, and writing reports.
Tons of research experience
Valuable life skills and work experience. I learned how to conduct myself in a work office environment, psychobehavioral treatment methods, mood assessments, etc.

I gained an understanding of the operations of the Yale Infant Cognition Center and the process of Psychology research.  I was able to begin preparing for my thesis.  I learned to code data and use video programs and the center's database.
I learned how to strategically analyze research papers especially research data and how to better evaluate research work
My lab experience continues to add to my overall education.

I learned a lot about running psychology studies in practice. I learned how to program studies on qualtrics, and how to create false news articles as used in studies. Moreover, I learned a lot about working on research in a lab with others, and how to conduct my own research in the future.
independent research rocks!
Very helpful in preparation for research on a thesis or in the future.

This course allows you to work closely with a mentor who has experience and knowledge of the the field you're interested in. It's great exposure to how research works and allows you to experience it firsthand. It allowed me to develop a great professional relationship with a grad student with whom I feel comfortable going to for academic advice. He also offered me constant feedback on my work (such as my writing), which was very helpful in several of my other classes as well. It can seem like a lot of work some weeks and not enough others; you have to be able to structure your time well.
Professor Clark always made time to meet with me. She helped direct me in the best ways of researching information.
Professor Baskin-Sommers is an excellent researcher and PI.

I found this course to be great. I think it is very important that the course requirements are determined between the lab advisor and the student, as this helped me be in constant communication with my advisor as to what I should be doing. I found this course to be very helpful for future planning regarding my senior thesis.
yes, awesome to get credit for lab work you may already be doing

I would recommend this course, it allows you to get hands on research experience and develop many important skills that will be useful later on in life whether you are conducting research or in the work force.

I would recommend this course to any motivated student interested in research. You get out of the course what you put into it, so if you're willing to put a lot of effort and work in, you'll definitely get a lot of this course.
Yes. It was a great way to put knowledge learned in my other courses into actual practice.
If youre looking to work one on one with a professor but also listen to your fellow students and learn from the ideas, this is for you.
Yes, this is the best way to get real research experience.

I would definitely recommend this course to another psychology major. I think this was a great opportunity for me to get started with research, and really set me up for starting my thesis with confidence.
